bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 90 (Thursday, May 23, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. MAST:H.R. 8542.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Artilce I, Section 8, Clause 6The single subject of this legislation is:This bill would award Dr. Joseph B. Kirsner with aCongressional Gold Medal in recognition of his service to theUnited States during World War II and his contributions tothe medical field, particularly, gastroenteroloy.[Page H3524]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.title: Dr. Joseph B. Kirsner Congressional Gold Medal Act

item.title: Dr. Joseph B. Kirsner Congressional Gold Medal Act
Dr. Joseph B. Kirsner Congressional Gold Medal Act

To award a Congressional Gold Medal to Dr. Joseph B. Kirsner, in recognition of his service to the United States during World War II and his contributions to the medical field, particularly gastroenterology.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
